title: losing e-mails when transfering them
content: In Thunderbird, I lose e-mails when I try to transfer them from my "in" box to my "save" box. I've deleted a lot of e-mails, hoping that would help. But it didn't. Can anyone help me figure out what's happening?

title: Gmail changes August 2024
content:
Thunderbird needs to change its coding very soon because all Google Gmail account holders who are transferring their mail to Mozilla will no longer have access near the end of the month. Google is cutting us off. They say that it's a security issue because they cannot verify authorization. Since their decision is final, Mozilla Thunderbird must adapt by changing the email programming before August 24th.

So, Mozilla, what are you going to do and why has this been kept quiet? It seems that Microsoft will still cooperate but forget Google.

Andy
creator: adbeng

title: No Column Headers in Message List
content:
I am running TB 115.14.0 on a Mac. The layout is unlike anything I've seen before and I can't find a way to restore the layout I am used to and greatly prefer. Most obviously there are no column headers and no separate "From" column. I have seen several references to similar problems and a couple of them referred to "card view" vs. "table view," but I see no reference to those settings anywhere in my installation and the pages mentioning them do not seem to be describing TB for Mac.

This problem means I have no way of sorting messages by sender. (I can of course search for a given sender but that is hardly the same thing.) This problem has me thinking for the first time in years of looking for another email client. I hope there is a solution.
creator: drewtrott

title: foutmelding bij starten Firefox
content:
Bij het starten van Firefox (met het icoontje op de taakbalk) krijg ik een foutmelding (zie afbeelding). Mijn provider heeft onlangs veranderingen doorgevoerd, die ik zo goed mogelijk heb verwerkt. Overal waar ik 48 tegenkwam heb ik dat gewijzigd in 150. Of server48 naar server150. Ik krijg mijn post nu binnen en kan ook mail versturen. Dat lijkt allemaal goed te staan.

Alleen deze foutmelding blijft over. Mijn provider helpt me niet verder. Ze blijven zeggen: server48 moet nu zijn server150. Maar ik kan deze instelling niet vinden. Die moet ergens in Firefox zitten, denk ik.

Wie kan me helpen?

Anneke Tulp
creator: anneke1

title: Mise en conformité de Thunderbird/Outlook.com
content:
Bonjour, J'ai passé Thundebird en OAuth2, en IMAP et en SMTP avec la nouvelle appellation des serveurs en office365.com. ça marche, puisque Microsoft m'en voie cette fenêtre qui doit être acceptée part Thunderbird. Il n'y a pas de lien, comment obtenir l'accord de Thunderbird. A moins que ce soit moi qui doit donner l'autorisation à Thunderbird ? Voici la fenêtre de Microsoft. Autoriser cette application à accéder à vos informations ? (1 sur 1 applications) Mozilla Thunderbird Thunderbird a besoin de votre autorisation pour : • Accès à la consultation et la rédaction de vos e-mails • Accès à la consultation et la rédaction de vos e-mails • Accès en lecture et en écriture via les Services Web Exchange • Accès à l'envoi d'e-mails à partir de votre boîte aux lettres • Conserver l'accès aux données auxquelles vous avez donné l'accès à Thunderbird Accepter ces autorisations signifie que vous autorisez cette application à utiliser vos données comme indiqué dans les conditions d'utilisation du service et la déclaration de confidentialité. L'éditeur n'a pas fourni de liens vers ses conditions pour vous permettre de les consulter. Vous pouvez modifier ces autorisations à l'adresse https://microsoft.com/consent. Vous ne devez accepter que si vous avez confiance dans l'éditeur et si vous avez sélectionné cette application à partir d'une boutique ou d'un site web qui vous inspire confiance. Masquer les détails Conditions d'utilisation Confidentialité et cookies Accessibilité : partiellement conforme

Comment résoudre ce problème ? Merci de votre aide
creator: clo.claudius

title: Can I expect this two-part filter sequence to work as expected [before Junk Classication / after Junk Classification]
content:
I'm under the impression that the following setup used to work well, but ceased to sometime in the past:

Filter 1: ("junk from unknown senders"), enabled. - Apply filter when: Manually run, Getting new mail -> Filter before Junk Classification. - Match all of the following: From - isn't in my address book - Personal Address Book. - Perform these actions: Set Junk Status to: Junk.

Filter 2: ("delete all junk"), enabled. - Apply filter when: Manually run, Getting new mail -> Filter after Junk Classification. - Match all of the following: Junk status - is - Junk. - Perform these actions: Move Message to - Junk on myaddress@myprovider.com.

Filter 2 is lower down the list of filters.

Filter 2 works as I expect it when I run it manually with 'Tools'->'Run Filters on Folder'. However it is either never executed, or never succeeds in moving messages to the Junk folder when it is called automatically under the "Getting new mail" condition. I check mail automatically every 10 minutes on this IMAP account, but the messages marked as Junk by filter 1 are never moved to the Junk folder.

What might explain this?

Thanks and appreciation to all the volunteers answering questions for the public on this site.

Details: running v115.13.0 on Debian.
creator: lbc

title: Failed authentication error on Thunderbird using comcast/Xfinity email accounts
content:
Have used Thunderbird with Comcast/Xfinity for over 10 years. I can receive all of my email on Thunderbird. About 6 months ago I started to not be able to send emails from Thunderbird sporadically, but it has escalated to the point of not being able to send emails of my comcast.net accounts at all. From my gmail accounts I can send messages just fine through Thunderbird. Three weeks ago I spent 2 hours on the phone with Xfinity. Reset all the passwords, checked all the settings, etc etc. For the rest of that day I could send all emails through Thunderbird. Ever since that day, same problem. I spent another 2 hours on the phone yesterday with Xfinity and they are sending my issue to a 3rd or 4th tier support person. They say there is no guarantee they will find a solution and that I won't hear back until Monday or Tuesday. Also this is the same problem on 2 different computers. One computer has the newest Thunderbird update to version 128.1.0esr and the other has the last version of Thunderbird as 115.14.0.

Here is the exact error message I get when I try to send an email:

Sending of message failed. An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: resomta-s2p-647654.sys.comcast.net resomta-s2p-647654.sys.comcast.net Excessive failed authentication, ESMTP server temporarily not available.

The numbers after s2p- change for each attempt to send an email.

Believe me I have tried all sorts of different settings and I have read practically all of the solutions I could find on Mozilla's support forums and articles.

Really need help on this one. Jennifer
creator: jcmpif

title: Recovering emails from IMAP server
content:
My wife's computer crashed and I've brought it back to life, but her Thunderbird profile is now gone. We have an IMAP server with all of her emails stored there, going back years. When I configure her email back to that server, is it going to automatically begin downloading all of her old 'read' email, as well as whatever 'unread' she's missed over the past few days? Or, is the IMAP server going to look at her new Thunderbird folder and seeing that there is no email there, attempt to match that on the server end by deleting everything 'read' at the server and only downloading what is 'unread' into her Thunderbird?

I can access her email by Webmail and it's all still there, but I want to make sure I'm not going to create a problem once I reconfigure it on Thunderbird on her computer. I'm guessing I could mark everything as unread in Webmail and then it will all be viewed as needed to be downloaded locally.

Any suggestions you might have are greatly appreciated.
creator: kash5

title: Sending Gmail Slow
content:
Been a Tbird user (and donor) for years. Last few months sending Gmail is slow, frequently:

Often 30-60 seconds with just text in email Can be >60 seconds when forwarding an email with embedded links or when sending an attachment.

My setup below. No other app or network issues on my 2 year old Dell Windows 11 PC or with other devices in my home Eero mesh network. No non-Tbird Gmail problems from my phone or iPad.

Any simple solutions here? Thanks.

My Thunderbird Specs

Version 128.1.0 (problem has existed well before this release over last few months) with all installation server setting defaults: pop.gmail.com Port 995 smtp.gmail.com Port 465 Secure Connect SSL/TLS Authentication method OAuth2
creator: msilvers50

title: Only show unread count for inbox
content:
Is there a way to show only the inbox's unread count in the sidebar when the account is collapsed?

Currently any unread messages are being counted, but personally I would like a way to only show the count number if those messages are in the inbox.

One example of this is sometimes I do not need to read a message and immediately archive it without reading and do not need to include that in the count, but its still nice to leave it unread in the All Mail folder just for future reference.
creator: daraeman
